alert.note: Alert for Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; Mathews; Middlesex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 4:19PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Gloucester, southeastern Middlesex, southeastern King and Queen, east central Charles City, northwestern York, Mathews, and central James City Counties and the City of Williamsburg through 500 PM EDT... At 419 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Shacklefords to near Norge to near Toano. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Gloucester Courthouse around 435 PM EDT. Queens Lake and Hayes around 445 PM EDT. Hartfield around 450 PM EDT. Mathews, Gloucester Point, Mobjack, Wicomico, Blakes, Gwynn and Achilles around 500 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Croaker, Ruff, Beulah, Moon, Laban, Camp Peary, Glass, Naxera, Harcum and Cash. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for eastern, south central, southeastern and east central Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; Mathews; Middlesex
